intro: Stisseria elegans, commonly known as the elegant stisseria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Stisseria elegans is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and marshy areas.
